abstract: The company will pay a fine and revamp its procedures after the Occupational Safety and Health Administration found problems with trash compactors and cleaning chemicals in its stores.
snippet: The company will pay a fine and revamp its procedures after the Occupational Safety and Health Administration found problems with trash compactors and cleaning chemicals in its stores.
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart Stores has agreed to a corporatewide settlement to improve safety conditions related to trash compactors and cleaning chemicals in more than 2,800 of its stores, the United States Department of Labor announced on Wednesday.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Settles OSHA Case Over Cleaning Procedures
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Settles OSHA Case Over Cleaning Procedures
